Author: livipup
Text: You could always switch to an iron supplement if you're worried about anemia. Vitamin D would also be good. And probably potassium, but unless you get it as a powder you probably won't get enough to actually make a meaningful difference to your potassium levels. Unless you have problems that require you to limit your potassium intake that is.

Author: UnusualReport
Text: Unlike with alcohol, interactions with multivitamins doesn't automatically mean you cannot take any kind of vitamin. I think it's worth checking with your doctor (and maybe have iron supplement prescribed too)
